description: From be- (“about, around, excessively, all over”) +‎ scrape.

verbs.description: bescrape (third-person singular simple present bescrapes, present participle bescraping, simple past and past participle bescraped)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To scrape all over; scrape excessively.
examples: I had rather hear A pedlar's kit bescrape a dancing dog.
